wash up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to wash plates, dishes, knives etc
wash up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if waves wash something up, they carry it to the shore
wash up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: His body was washed up on the beach the next morning.
wash up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the wash-up period is the last few days of the British parliament, after a general election has been announced. During this time the government tries to get remaining laws passed quickly, with the help of the opposition parties
wash up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The bill was pushed through quickly during wash-up, and some MPs have complained that there was not enough opportunity for a democratic debate.
